metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14064 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Ruby through 2.2.7, 2.3.x through 2.3.4, and 2.4.x through 2.4.1 can exposearbitrary memory during a JSON.generate call. The issues lies in usingstrdup in ext/json/ext/generator/generator.c, which will stop afterencountering a '\0' byte, returning a pointer to a string of length zero,which is not the length stored in space_len.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14064` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
libtcltk-ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ri1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ruby1.9.1-examples - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ruby1.9.1-full - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
ruby1.9.3 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

libruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10
ruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10
ruby2.0-tcltk - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby1.9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.5').
ruby2.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10').
